file_content.text: Okay, last building. Come on, everyone. Single-file, not too fast. Not too slow, either.
Get your hands off me! Blasted Republic interlopers... I know my rights! I'm not going anywhere!
Well, I'll be a Wookiee's uncle. I knew we'd find your building sooner or later. It's Roop, isn't it?
Roop and his family are old friends. They send the Protectors strongly worded holomessages before every Makeb evac.
Seems the Hutts promised them bonus pay if they stayed inside. Roop here thinks we're trying to cheat him out of his credits.
The Protectors are an official Republic unit. They perform evacuations like this all the time.
This is the real thing.
The perfect front for a gang of looters and thieves!
He's got you there.
A Jedi has no interest in material wealth. I can vouch for all these people.
They can trust me.
Shame on you, bringing a Jedi into your scam!
What, you think Jedi aren't desperate, too? Look at what they wear!
I'm the commander of Havoc Squad. That comes with a pretty high pay grade.
I don't need credits.
Sure does, when you're stealing it from the locals like a common thug!
Well, that's uncalled for. There's nothing common about us!
Look, buddy, I'll do a lot of things for credits, but this isn't one of them. Probably.
That's not my style.
Scamming honest, hard-working folk--you're no better than Shalim!
The rich guy bankrolling this fight? We should all be that terrible.
What do the Hutts gain by making their workers stay in dangerous areas?
Why pay them to stay inside?
Our combined weight helps maintain the structural integrity, or something.
I could name ten things wrong with that sentence. Half of them aren't even engineering-related.
You're not getting a bonus. Your idiot employers have drilled Makeb into an early grave.
News flash, morons....
Everyone knows the groundquakes are entirely natural. Have been for months.
That doesn't even make any--fine. They're natural. A building is still no place to be during one.
The rest of you can cut and run if you like, but me and mine are staying right here. It's quadruple overtime, people!
Need you outside, sir. One of the speeders blew a hoverpad on the way back.
Talk them down, will you? Or bribe them--we're good for it. Meet you back at base.
You show me an order from Vice Commandant Grevin, my foreman or Toborro himself. Otherwise, I'm not moving.
There's no more time to argue about this. What will it take to make you leave this building?
We have to leave now.
I want my bonus. Unless you've raided the Hutt treasury, I know you don't have it.
The Republic will compensate you for your lost bonus pay. Whatever percentage you want.
We have our own credits.
All right. How about a little now to prove it?
Wow. You weren't kidding.
Doesn't matter to me where the creds come from. Point me towards the exit.
They didn't want me to tell you this, but the Republic's already cleared the vaults.
[Lie] Actually, we did.
But... how are they going to pay us?
They're not. I knew I should have volunteered for the militia!
No point in sticking around here. At least you're providing transport after robbing us.
You can leave by your own two feet, or I can drag you out one by one. Your choice.
Move or I hit you.
Okay, okay, we're going! Just take it easy.
I can see you're not fools. But I came here for credits, and I'm not leaving without them.
Split the credits with me.
You mean Roop was right? You're actually robbing us?
Didn't I tell you? Blasted parasites.... Better give 'em what you've got.
That was my last month's pay, you rotten scab. Now get out of here and leave us alone!
Why? Going to steal my identity, too?
